\sphinxAtStartPar
Implements Algorithm 4: Generative model for entire power grid graph on k voltage levels.
\index{generate\_grid() (powergrid\_synth.PowerGridGenerator method)@\spxentry{generate\_grid()}\spxextra{powergrid\_synth.PowerGridGenerator method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.PowerGridGenerator.generate_grid}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{generate\_grid}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{degrees\_by\_level}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}List\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{diameters\_by\_level}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{transformer\_degrees}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Dict\DUrole{p}{{[}}Tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }int\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }Tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}List\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }List\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{keep\_lcc}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ Graph}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Procedure CLCSTARS(\{d\_xi\}, \{delta\_xi\}, \{t{[}Xi, Xj{]}\}) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} E
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{degrees\_by\_level}} \textendash{} List of degree sequences, one for each voltage level.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{diameters\_by\_level}} \textendash{} List of target diameters, one for each voltage level.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{transformer\_degrees}} \textendash{} Dictionary mapping level pairs (i, j) to a tuple of transformer degree lists.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{keep\_lcc}} \textendash{} If True, returns only the Largest Connected Component of the generated grid, removing isolated islands. Default: True

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A NetworkX graph representing the entire multi\sphinxhyphen{}level grid.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{grid data generator}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:grid-data-generator}}\index{BusTypeAllocator (class in powergrid\_synth)@\spxentry{BusTypeAllocator}\spxextra{class in powergrid\_synth}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.BusTypeAllocator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{powergrid\_synth.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BusTypeAllocator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{graph}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Graph}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{entropy\_model}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Assigns bus types (Generator, Load, Connection) to a power grid topology
using an Artificial Immune System (AIS) optimization algorithm to match
target topological entropy properties.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Ported and adapted from ‘sg\_bus\_type.m’ (SynGrid).
\index{TYPE\_CONN (powergrid\_synth.BusTypeAllocator attribute)@\spxentry{TYPE\_CONN}\spxextra{powergrid\_synth.BusTypeAllocator attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.BusTypeAllocator.TYPE_CONN}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TYPE\_CONN}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }3}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{TransmissionLineAllocator (class in powergrid\_synth)@\spxentry{TransmissionLineAllocator}\spxextra{class in powergrid\_synth}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.TransmissionLineAllocator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{powergrid\_synth.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TransmissionLineAllocator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{graph}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Graph}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{ref\_sys\_id}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{1}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Allocates impedance (X, R) and Capacity Limits to transmission lines.
Based on ‘sg\_flow\_lim.m’ from SynGrid.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Steps:
1. Initialize random impedances (Zpr) based on LogNormal distribution.
2. Run iterative DCPF (Swapping Logic):
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate flows.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Assign lower Impedance (Z) to lines with higher Flow.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Perform random swaps to introduce variance.

\end{itemize}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{2}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
(Optional) Topology Refinement:
\sphinxhyphen{} Add low\sphinxhyphen{}impedance lines to bridge large phase angle differences.
\sphinxhyphen{} Remove weak (high\sphinxhyphen{}impedance) lines to maintain grid density.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Allocate Capacity:
\sphinxhyphen{} Use ‘Tab\_2D\_FlBeta’ to assign Capacity Factors (Beta).
\sphinxhyphen{} Capacity = Flow / Beta.

\end{enumerate}
\index{allocate() (powergrid\_synth.TransmissionLineAllocator method)@\spxentry{allocate()}\spxextra{powergrid\_synth.TransmissionLineAllocator method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.TransmissionLineAllocator.allocate}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{allocate}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{refine\_topology}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ Dict\DUrole{p}{{[}}Tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }int\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Main execution method.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Utilities
\index{GridVisualizer (class in powergrid\_synth)@\spxentry{GridVisualizer}\spxextra{class in powergrid\_synth}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.GridVisualizer}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{powergrid\_synth.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GridVisualizer}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Visualization module for synthetic power grids.
Allows plotting the grid with different layouts including Yifan Hu, Kamada\sphinxhyphen{}Kawai, and Voltage Layered.
\index{plot\_bus\_types() (powergrid\_synth.GridVisualizer method)@\spxentry{plot\_bus\_types()}\spxextra{powergrid\_synth.GridVisualizer method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.GridVisualizer.plot_bus_types}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_bus\_types}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{graph}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Graph}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{layout}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}kamada\_kawai\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{title}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}Bus Type Visualization\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{show\_impedance}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{figsize}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{(12, 10)}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Visualizes the grid coloring nodes by their Bus Type (Static). Option to show impedance on edges.

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_load\_gen\_bubbles}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{grid}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Graph}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{layout}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}kamada\_kawai\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{title}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}Generation vs Load\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{show\_impedance}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{figsize}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{ }int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{(12, 10)}}}{}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bubble plot showing generation and load magnitudes.
Generators are blue squares, Loads are red circles.
Size is proportional to capacity/load.
Optionally plots impedance on edges.

\index{GridExporter (class in powergrid\_synth)@\spxentry{GridExporter}\spxextra{class in powergrid\_synth}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.GridExporter}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{powergrid\_synth.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GridExporter}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{graph}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{Graph}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{base\_mva}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{float}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{100.0}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{base\_kv}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{float}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{230.0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Exports the generated synthetic grid to standard file formats.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
MATPOWER (.m):
\sphinxhyphen{} Standard bridge for Pypowsybl (pypowsybl.network.load)
\sphinxhyphen{} Supported by Pandapower (pandapower.converter.from\_mpc)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Pandapower CSVs (Folder):
\sphinxhyphen{} Converts PU to Physical units (Ohms, kA) based on V\_base=230kV.
\sphinxhyphen{} Column names match pandapower.create\_* parameters.

\end{enumerate}
\index{export\_to\_matpower() (powergrid\_synth.GridExporter method)@\spxentry{export\_to\_matpower()}\spxextra{powergrid\_synth.GridExporter method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:powergrid_synth.GridExporter.export_to_matpower}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{export\_to\_matpower}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{filepath}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Saves the grid to a MATPOWER (.m) file.
This is the preferred format for bridging with Pypowsybl.

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}
